title: Introduction
content: The Hogwarts Summer School is a one-week immersive research program by New Uzbekistan University for high school (grades 9â€“11) and university students. It offers hands-on experience in various disciplines with a Hogwarts-themed atmosphere.

title: Goals
content: The program aims to develop students' research skills, build a vibrant community, and cultivate leadership. Focus areas include STEM, political science, and community engagement.

title: Milestones
content: Key milestones include funding applications (Autumn 2024), application period (Winter 2025), online mentoring (Spring 2025), remote project work (June/July), and the one-week immersive camp (August 2025).

title: Student Selection Process
content: Eligible students apply through three stages: (1) essay and CV, (2) research case study, and (3) interview. Communication happens mainly via the official Telegram channel.

title: Academic Program Overview
content: Covers topics like software technologies, institutions, ecology, and education. Uses the SPRINT methodology over 12 weeks of online sessions starting early March until mid-May.

title: Social Engagement Activities
content: Includes Quidditch tournaments, magical creature exhibits, and collaboration workshops. Major activities occur during the camp in August 2025 near Tashkent.
source: Program Schedule: Hogwarts Summer School Project 2025

title: Budgeting
content: Estimated cost per participant is $87. Funding depends on sponsors; otherwise, self-funding is required. Max capacity is 200 students.
source: Budget Plan for Hogwarts Summer School Project 2024

title: Previous Cohorts & Statistics
content: Covers four previous cohorts from 2022 to 2024. The project's website offers demographic stats and regional data of applicants.

title: Main Initiator
content: New Uzbekistan University supports the program with expertise, dormitories, financial help, transportation, and administrative assistance.

title: Contact Information
content: Phone: +998 93-755-77-52 (School), +998 71-202-41-11 (University). Emails: schoolinfo@newuu.uz, info@newuu.uz. Socials: Website, Telegram, YouTube, Instagram.
